docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 27--The sanguinary revolution in Bolivia has served to focus attention dramatically upon unrest in South America--unrest which is not confined to that one country, even though its results elsewhere have not been so drastic.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 27--The sanguinary revolution in Bolivia has served to focus attention dramatically upon unrest in South America--unrest which is not confined to that one country, even though its results elsewhere have not been so drastic.

headline.main: SOUTH AMERICAN UNREST WIDESPREAD; Bolivia's Revolt Is a Sign That Tension Is Rising

docs.snippet: The Moore-McCormack liner Brazil, from which diptheria antitoxin was transferred to the troopship Colby Victory at sea last Wednesday, arrived at Pier 54, North River, yesterday from Le Havre, Cobh and Southampton with 531 passengers.

docs.snippet: Dr. Francisco G. Yanes, former Venezuelan journalist, jurist and diplomat, died Saturday evening of a heart attack in his apartment in the Gainsborough Studios, 222 Central Park South. His age was 61.
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Francisco G. Yanes, former Venezuelan journalist, jurist and diplomat, died Saturday evening of a heart attack in his apartment in the Gainsborough Studios, 222 Central Park South. His age was 61.

docs.snippet: New efforts are being made to remedy an admittedly unsatisfactory situation regarding recruitment of personnel for the Secretariat of the United Nations, it was learned yesterday.

docs.snippet: The United Nations General Assembly is expected to last from six to seven weeks, with a six-day week, no night sessions, and all meetings both of the Assembly and its committees open to the public, it was announced yesterday.
